intro: Camaridium antonellii, commonly known as the Antonelli's camaridium, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and palmate leaves with a velvety texture. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink and white, often with a yellow center. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
